image_generation_provider_label:
Choose the service that will create images for your video. 

- Pollinations - free using kontext and turbo models. To use better models, an API key is required. 
- Googler - Highest quality service using Google Imagen 4, API key can be obtained via Telegram bot. 
- ElevenLabsImage - Slightly lower quality than Googler, but free.
results_path_label: The folder where the program will save all created tasks, images, and final videos. It is recommended to choose a drive with enough free space.
detailed_logging_label: Enables recording of detailed technical information about the program's operation. Useful for diagnosing errors and understanding generation processes. It is recommended to keep it enabled as the program clears old logs automatically.
translation_review_label:
Pauses the program after text translation so you can review and adjust it before the next stages. 
You will have the opportunity to regenerate the translation, as well as change translation settings and the prompt for one specific time.
rewrite_review_label:
Pauses the program after text rewrite so you can check the quality of paraphrasing. 
You will have the opportunity to regenerate the rewrite, as well as change rewrite settings and the prompt for one specific time.
image_review_label: Pauses the program after image generation, allowing you to review them in the gallery, delete or regenerate unsuccessful ones before video montage.
prompt_count_control_label:
Prompt control allows you to control the number of prompts returned by the neural network. If, for example, your prompt is set to 50 prompts, 
but the neural network returned 30 prompts due to an error, the program will automatically verify the count and regenerate the result if it differs from the specified number. 
If after 3 attempts the program fails to get the desired number of prompts, the last received number of prompts will be used.
max_download_threads_label: The number of simultaneous threads for downloading content during rewriting. More threads speed up work but may load the network.
max_concurrent_requests:
The number of simultaneous requests to the neural network. It is recommended to set from 5 to 10 depending on your API key limits.
Higher numbers may lead to 'Rate Limit' errors.
openrouter_add_model_hint: To add a new model, copy its full name from the OpenRouter website (e.g., 'google/gemini-2.0-flash-exp:free') and paste it into this field, then click the 'Add' button. The added model will appear in the list above.
char_limit:
This is the maximum number of characters that your current Voicemaker subscription plan allows you to voice in a single request.
If the text is longer, the program will automatically split it into parts (chunks) according to this limit.
pollinations_model_label: Selection of the model for image generation. Different models have different styles and capabilities.
pollinations_token_label:
Entering the Pollinations API key (token). Without an API key, there are very strict restrictions, with images limited to 15 seconds (this is a restriction of the PollinationsAI service). Therefore, obtain a free API access key at https://enter.pollinations.ai/ to generate 1 image in 5 seconds. 
Without a key, the following models are available: flux, trubo, zimage. 
With a key, the following models are available: kontext, nanobanana, seedream, seedance, veo.
image_size_label: Settings for the resolution of generated images (Width x Height). It is recommended to use standard sizes, such as 1280x720.
nologo_label: If enabled, the program will try to generate images without the Pollinations watermark.
enhance_prompt_label: Automatic enhancement of your text prompt by the neural network to get a more detailed and higher quality result.
googler_aspect_ratio_label: Selection of the aspect ratio for generated images (landscape, portrait, or square).
googler_max_threads_label: The number of simultaneous threads for image generation. This setting can be left at default for the best generation performance.
googler_max_video_threads_label: The number of simultaneous threads for video animation generation. This setting can be left at default for best performance.
googler_video_prompt_label: Additional description for creating animation from an image. This prompt applies globally to all generations.
googler_seed_label: A random number to reproduce identical results. If left blank, a new result will be used each time. Applies globally to all generations.
googler_negative_prompt_label: What should NOT be in the image (e.g., distorted hands, defects). Applies globally to all generations.
elevenlabs_image_aspect_ratio: Selection of the aspect ratio for generated images.
elevenlabs_image_max_threads: The number of simultaneous threads for image generation. 10 threads is more than enough.
assemblyai_max_threads: The number of simultaneous threads for transcription. By default, everyone has a limit of 5 concurrent requests, so it's better not to touch this setting.
language_prompt_label:
This is an instruction for the neural network that defines the style, tone, and translation rules. When performing a task, the program combines your prompt with the text to be translated. 
Request structure: {Prompt} + {Translation Text or Original}.
translation_model_label: Choice of the AI model for translation. The list shows models added in the Settings > API > OpenRouter tab.
tokens_label:
Maximum token limit for the AI response. Controls the length of the generated text and helps avoid overspending or incomplete answers.
If you set a limit of 128,000 tokens, it doesn't mean the AI will always respond with a length of 128k tokens; it is a constraint that the AI cannot exceed.
Therefore, for a complete response, it is recommended to set a limit of 128,000 tokens. It is the maximum.
temperature_label:
The model's creativity parameter. Lower values (0.1–0.5) ensure accuracy and stability,
while higher values (0.8–1.5) make the text more varied but less predictable.
rewrite_prompt_label:
This is an instruction for the neural network that defines the style and rules for rewriting (paraphrasing). The program combines your prompt with the text for rewriting. 
Request structure: {Prompt} + {Text for rewriting}.
rewrite_model_label: Choice of the AI model for rewriting. The list shows models added in the Settings > API > OpenRouter tab.
rewrite_tokens_label:
Maximum token limit for the AI response during rewriting. Controls the text length. 
For a complete response, it is recommended to set a limit of 128,000 tokens. It is the maximum.
rewrite_temperature_label: The model's creativity parameter during rewriting. Lower values ensure results closer to the original, while higher values provide more free and creative paraphrasing.
default_template_label: You can apply a template that will be automatically selected when this language is chosen for translation or rewriting. It shows templates created in the Templates tab.
tts_provider_label: Voiceover service. To use the selected service, please ensure you have configured it in the Settings > API > Audio tab.
background_music_label: Adding background music to the video. If the audio file is shorter than the video, the program will automatically loop it.
music_volume_label: Allows you to adjust the background music volume so it creates ambiance without overpowering the voiceover.
elevenlabs_template_label: Selection of a pre-configured voice template. The list includes profiles created and configured through the ElevenLabs Telegram bot.
eleven_unlim_voice_id_label: Unique identifier (Voice ID) from the ElevenLabs library. It is recommended to use free voices. Stability and similarity parameters can be further tuned in the settings below.
voicemaker_voice_label: Selection of a voice model from the available VoiceMaker library. Each voice features unique timbre and intonational characteristics.
edgetts_voice_label: Selection of a system voice from the EdgeTTS service. To preview and select the most suitable option, use the official website (link provided in Settings > API > Audio > EdgeTTS).
overlay_effect_label: Selection of visual overlay effects with transparency applied over the video to create ambiance (similar to effects in CapCut).
watermark_label: Adding a static image (logo or icon) to a specified corner of the video. The size and position of the watermark can be adjusted below.
language_name_label:
The name of the language for your convenience. It will be displayed in the task card on the Queue tab,
and a project folder with this name will be created to store all generated data.
language_id_label:
A critical setting for correct transcription, especially when using the Whisper (AMD/Fork) engine.
Specify the two-letter language code (e.g., uk for Ukrainian, en for English) to ensure accurate speech recognition.
prompt_content_label: General prompt for generating prompts for subsequent image generation. Request structure: {Prompt} + {Translated text or Original}.
image_model_label: The model that will be used to create prompts. Displays models added on the API > OpenRouter tab.
prompt_count_label:
Prompt control allows you to control the number of prompts returned by the neural network.
If, for example, your prompt is set to 50 prompts, and the neural network returns 30 prompts due to an error, the program will automatically check the count, and if it differs from the specified count, it will regenerate the result.
If the program fails to obtain the desired number of prompts after 3 attempts, the last obtained number of prompts will be used.
custom_stages_label:
You have the ability to create your own custom stages where you can enter absolutely anything to get the information you need.
Executed immediately after translation, or if the Translation stage is disabled, the original text is used.
You can use this, for example, to create headlines for your text or a YouTube description for the video. Request structure: {Prompt} + {Translation or Original text}.
parallel_stage_name_label: The name of the stage that will be displayed in the stage list when selecting a language for video creation and in the task card. A file with the result will also be created with this name in the final project folder.
codec_label:
The codec that will be used for video montage. libx264 works for everyone, it uses the CPU and is the most stable. 
You can experiment with other codecs to evaluate speed, quality, and final video weight. For macOS, it's recommended to use the macOS-specific codec.
preset_label:
Determines the quality and degree of video compression, and also significantly affects the montage speed.
It is recommended to use superfast - high speed with decent compression.
bitrate_label: Affects video quality and pixelation. For slide-based videos, 5Mbps is recommended. This impacts montage speed and the final video weight.
upscale_factor_label:
The factor by which the video will be upscaled to ensure smooth swaying animations. This significantly affects montage speed and file weight. 
Recommended setting is 2.00x.
duration_label: Duration of transitions between slides in seconds.
enable_zoom_label: Frame zoom effects, zoom in and zoom out.
zoom_speed_factor_label: How fast the frame will zoom.
zoom_intensity_label: How intensely the frame will zoom.
enable_sway_label:
Swaying the frame from side to side and small circular movements. 
The smoothness of swaying is affected by the 'Upscale Factor' setting in the Render settings block at the beginning of this tab.
sway_speed_factor_label: How fast the frame will move.
special_proc_mode_label:
Determines how the program will process N images at the beginning of the video:
- Disabled: the program simply makes a regular slide show, stretching each image evenly over time.
- Quick show: the program takes N first images in the list and shows each for a specific amount of time. This is created for dynamics at the beginning. For example, 5 images at 5 seconds each means 5 images will be shown in the first 25 seconds, and the other images will stretch over the remaining video time.
- Video at the beginning: the program takes N first images and tries to animate them using the Googler service and Veo3 model. The original images used for animation are deleted, and videos take their place.
special_proc_check_sequence_label:
Setting for checking the sequence of generated images before animating. For example: you have 3 videos set at the beginning. 
If the program generated images numbered 1, 2, 3, the sequence is preserved and the program will animate these images. 
If the program generated only images 2 and 3, there is no sequence, so it will switch to 'Quick show'. 
If images 1 and 2 are generated, the sequence is preserved but the program will only make 2 videos out of 3.
max_concurrent_montages_label:
The number of simultaneously launched video renders. It all depends on the power of your processor. 
For a 16-thread CPU, 2 simultaneous montages work well, so you need to test for your specific hardware.
standard_python_hint: Standard (Python) - OpenAI's default library for audio transcription. It works everywhere but has one drawback: on Windows with an AMD GPU, the load will fall entirely on your CPU because this library doesn't support AMD hardware acceleration. In this case, use AMD(GPU\Fork).
amd_gpu_fork_hint: AMD(GPU\Fork) - an external library supporting AMD GPUs for better transcription performance. To use this library, you need to separately download the library files and the required models. Also, when using this library, it's crucial to correctly set the language ID in the Languages tab (e.g., 'uk' for Ukrainian).
assemblyai_hint: AssemblyAI - a cloud-based service for audio transcription. It places no load on your PC and allows up to 5 concurrent transcriptions. Model selection is not supported. To use it, you must obtain an API key from their website; the link is located in Settings\API\AssemblyAI tab.
whisper_model_hint: Speed and quality of transcription depend on the selected model. For most tasks, the 'base' model is suitable. The higher and heavier the model, the longer the transcription will take, but quality increases significantly. Recommendation: use 'base' or 'small'.
vertical_margin_hint: Changes the vertical position of subtitles, always centered. Measured in pixels.
fade_hint: Adjusts the fade-in and fade-out effect of subtitles so it's not abrupt.
max_words_hint: The number of words that will appear on the screen simultaneously. Fewer words mean more frequent subtitle changes for dynamics; more words mean stay on screen longer.
template_list_hint: A list of your saved templates. Selecting a template here doesn't change anything globally, so don't worry.
template_name_hint: If the template exists, its name is displayed here. If it doesn't exist, the name for saving is taken from here. If overwriting an existing template, the name must match the one that already exists.
template_notes_hint: This is a note that doesn't affect anything. It serves purely for your convenience to mark differences in the template. Saved separately for each template.
template_edit_hint: This is the editor for the selected template. Choose a template from the list, click Edit, and you'll see a list of all settings saved in the template. You can change or view them without applying the template to the global program settings.
elevenlabs_proxy_hint: This setting is for users in Ukraine who cannot use ElevenLabs due to restrictions. Enable this setting and enter a proxy URL, format CUrl\http; all requests to ElevenLabs will go through the proxy.
template_save_hint: Saves settings to the template. Be careful: when saving, the settings of the selected template will be overwritten by the global settings currently saved in the program.
template_apply_hint: Applies the selected template to the entire program, overwriting current settings. Use with caution.
notifications_enable_hint: Enables Telegram notifications. The program will send important alerts about specific stages. For example, if Translation or Rewrite Review is enabled, the program will message you when the text for a language is ready. If Image Review is enabled, it will notify you when it's ready for montage with a request to review images for editing or continuation. Follow the link to activate the bot for the first time ensuring correct operation.
telegram_user_id_hint: Your account ID where the bot will send messages. You can click 'Get ID' to automatically retrieve your Telegram ID.
bot_link_hint: Follow the link to activate the bot for the first time to ensure it works correctly.
info_icon_hint:
— explanations next to each setting. Hover or click to see more details.

Stage statuses in queue:
● — not started
● — in progress
● — ready
● — only for images, not all images generated
● — error

Useful links:
Chat Soloveyko.AI: t.me/soloveyko_ai
Download the latest version: @SoloveykoAIManagerBot
Instructions (FAQ): t.me/faq
mass_edit_hint: This button allows you to mass edit a single parameter across multiple templates simultaneously. For example, if you want to change the translation model to 'gpt-4o' in all your templates, simply select the 'Translation Model' parameter, specify the new value, and choose the templates to apply the changes to.
